gameWorld 

interface gameWorld

Summary

Properties from gameWorld

number
aliveDiscs

An array containing the IDs of every disc currently alive.
number
angularSpeedCap

The maximum angular speed that objects can reach. It's set to 2700 by default.
boolean
disableDeathBarrier

When set to true, the barrier that kills players when they go offscreen is disabled.
number
linearSpeedCap

The maximum linear speed that objects can reach. It's set to 60 by default.

Public Methods

addShapeToPlat gmm.d.ts:1611 
addShapeToPlat(platId: number, shapeDef: physShape) → {number}

Add a shape to a platform.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
platId number

The ID of the platform
shapeDef physShape

The shape to be added. It's not necessary to specify every property of the shape here, any missing properties will be replaced with default values, so you can remove property definitions for stuff you don't need. For example: physical properties, as well as death, no grapple and inner grapple are not used in a no-physics shape, so you can remove those when defining one.
Returns:
Type Description
number

The index at which the shape is located in the platform's shapes array.

clonePlatform(id: number, cloneJoints: boolean) → {number}

Parameters:
Name Type Description
id number

The ID of the platform to clone.
cloneJoints boolean

true if joints attached to this platform should be cloned as well, false otherwise.
Returns:
Type Description
number

The ID of the newly created platform clone

number

createPlatform gmm.d.ts:1595 
createPlatform(viewOrder: number, platformDef: platform) → {number}

Create a platform.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
viewOrder number

Indicates where in game.state.physics.bro the platform ID should be placed. In other words, it indicates the layer at which the platform will be drawn, where the layer with the biggest number is the farthest layer, and the layer with the smallest number (down to 0) is the nearest layer. If you set this to null, the platform will be placed at the nearest layer (0).
platformDef platform

The platform to be created. It's not necessary to specify every property of the platform here, any missing properties will be replaced with default values, so you can remove property definitions for stuff you don't need. For example: velocity, drag, fixed rotation, apply forces, and some others are not sed on static platforms, so you can remove those when creating one.
Returns:
Type Description
number

The ID of the newly created platform
deletePlatform gmm.d.ts:1633 
deletePlatform(id: number) → {}

Delete the specified platform, and everything related to it, such as joints and capzone definitions. Drawings attached to the platform aren't deleted.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
id number

The ID of the platform to delete.
endRound gmm.d.ts:1666 
endRound() → {}

End the round immediately, without showing the win screen.

getDiscRadius gmm.d.ts:1572 
getDiscRadius(id: number) → {number}

Get the radius of a disc (affected by balance).

If given the ID of a disc that doesn't exist, it will return 1, as that's the size value of a disc with 0% balance.

It's recommended to only call this function once and store the value somewhere if you use it a lot in your code.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
id number

The ID of the disc.
Returns:
Type Description
number
getPlatIdByName gmm.d.ts:1639 
getPlatIdByName(name: string) → {number}

Find the ID of a platform by its name. Note that if there are multiple platforms with the same name, the one with the lowest ID will be chosen.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
name string

Name of the platform to search for
Returns:
Type Description
number

The ID of the platform
killDisc gmm.d.ts:1584 
killDisc(id: number, allowRespawn: boolean) → {}

Kill a specified disc.

The disc gets killed in the next step, so it will still exist until you move on to the next step.

It's also not possible to kill a disc while the game is frozen (at the start of a round).

Parameters:
Name Type Description
id number

The ID of the disc to kill.
allowRespawn boolean

When set to true, the disc can respawn (on maps that have "respawn on death" activated). When set to false, the disc can't respawn even if "respawn on death" is activated, like when someone claims a capzone. True by default.
movePlatShape gmm.d.ts:1619

fromIndex number

The index of the shape to be moved
toIndex number

The shape's new index
rayCast gmm.d.ts:1670 
rayCast(origin: vector2d, end: vector2d, filter: (hit: rayCastResult) => boolean) → {rayCastResult | null}

Cast a ray from an origin point in the world to an end point.

The filter function's job is to indicate where the ray should stop and return the results. When the ray hits something, the filter function is given details about the hit, and it must judge these details and return true if the hit is valid and the raycast should stop, or false if the hit is invalid and the raycast should keep going.

When the filter returns true, the raycast stops and returns the same info that was given to the filter. If the ray reaches the end position without the filter ever returning true, meaning that there's nothing left to hit, the raycast stops anyways and returns null.

Note: the shapeIndex and isCapzone properties in the hit results are only for type platform hits, and therefore are undefined in type disc and type arrow hits.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
origin vector2d

The start point of the ray, as a 2d vector, represented by a number array [x,y]
end vector2d

The end point of the ray, as a 2d vector, represented by a number array [x,y]
filter (hit: rayCastResult) => boolean

Filter function that dictates at which point the ray should stop.
Returns:
Type Description
rayCastResult | null
rayCastAll gmm.d.ts:1690 
rayCastAll(origin: vector2d, end: vector2d, filter: (hit: rayCastResult) => boolean) → {rayCastResult[]}

It's like a raycast, but it allows you to find multiple objects in the line.

When the filter returns true, the raycast doesn't stop, instead, it adds the hit info to an array that gets returned once the raycast gets to the end point.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
origin vector2d

The start point of the ray, as a 2d vector, represented by a number array [x,y]
end vector2d

The end point of the ray, as a 2d vector, represented by a number array [x,y]
filter (hit: rayCastResult) => boolean

Filter function that dictates what hits should be ignored and which shouldn't.
Returns:
Type Description
rayCastResult[]
removeShapeFromPlat gmm.d.ts:1627

Parameters:
Name Type Description
platId number

The ID of the platform
shapeIndex number

The index of the shape to be removed
triggerWin gmm.d.ts:1651 
triggerWin(id: number) → {}

End the round.

If teams are off, the win will correspond to the player with the specified id.

If teams are on, the win will correspond to:

  • Red Team if you specify an id of 2
  • Blue Team if you specify an id of 3
  • Green Team if you specify an id of 4
  • Yellow Team if you specify an id of 5

If you want the round to end with a draw, use an id of -1.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
id number
